text:
Question 76) A person needs the frictional force on his feet to move on a surface. Therefore, a person who rises a straight ramp will be assisted by the frictional force exerted on the floor on his feet.
Regarding this person's movement, what are the direction and meaning of the frictional force mentioned in the text?
A) Perpendicular to the plane and in the same sense as the movement.
B) parallel to the plane and in the opposite direction to movement.
C) parallel to the plane and in the same sense as the movement.
D) horizontal and in the same direction of movement.
E) vertical and towards upwards.
